channel.title: 1 error Ultra detailed
channel.description:
src\server\model\players\Player.java:54: <identifier> expected public int ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
I used a noob tut to add turmoil this is the only error i have,whats wrong in there

item.title: 1 error Ultra detailed
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:3, topic:379116”]Just for the sake of education, I’ll explain. When making an int you need to actually make a value, not just say ‘public int’.

e.g

public int myInt = 7;

You’ve probably not copy and pasted it correctly (The tutorial) thus missing of the actual int.[/quote]Actually no. He was missing some declarations in Player.java Aside from that, in the tutorial the fields were defined at once, e.g.:

public int something, somethingElse, somethingElseElse, etc;

But, he slipped up and put a semicolon instead of commas lol.

Read full topic

item.title: 1 error Ultra detailed
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Just for the sake of education, I’ll explain. When making an int you need to actually make a value, not just say ‘public int’.

e.g

public int myInt = 7;

You’ve probably not copy and pasted it correctly (The tutorial) thus missing of the actual int.

Read full topic

item.title: 1 error Ultra detailed
item.dc:creator: @Snackman Snackman
item.description:
@Snackman wrote:

This is really easy to fix.
The only thing you need to do, if that is the whole piece of code, is to delete it.
public int
doesn’t declare anything, so it’s useless… but remember: ONLY DELETE THAT IF THAT IS A PIECE OF CODE USED ON IT’S OWN.
I hope this will help you out

Read full topic
